questions.q: What is the fundamental principle behind the Ideology of Pakistan?
questions.ex: The Two-Nation Theory, which posited that Muslims and Hindus were two separate nations, is the fundamental principle behind the Ideology of Pakistan.

questions.q: Who is considered the philosophical father of the Ideology of Pakistan?
questions.ex: Allama Muhammad Iqbal, through his Allahabad Address in 1930, articulated the idea of a separate Muslim state in Northwest India, making him the philosophical father of the Ideology of Pakistan.

questions.ex: The main demand of the Lahore Resolution was the creation of independent states for Muslims in the Muslim-majority areas of British India.

questions.ex: The Ideology of Pakistan is primarily based on religious and cultural identity (Two-Nation Theory) rather than solely on territorial nationalism.
